item.title: Pokemon Fan Gives Charcadet Four Impressive New Evolutions
item.description:
Highlights

  • Creative Pokemon fan designs new evolutions for Charcadet, offering unique concepts and abilities for each form.
  • Charcadet's potential evolutions include Fire/Bug, Fire/Ground, Fire/Dragon, and Fire/Fighting types, each with their own evolution criteria.
  • Artist OnduRegion's detailed artwork and lore for Charcadet's evolutions captivates Pokemon fans, generating excitement for Pokemon Legends: Z-A.

A talented Pokemon fan has made four new evolutions for Charcadet, sharing the designs online. With the release of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , Pokemon fans saw the return of many Pokemon from other generations. Meanwhile, the Gen 9 games introduced 103 new critters with different abilities and stories to expand the already immense Pokemon universe.

One of these newcomers is Charcadet, a Fire-type Pokemon said to have been born from burning coal. To evolve Charcadet , Pokemon fans take two routes, one using Auspicious Armor to turn it into Armarouge, or Malicious Armor to evolve it into Ceruledge, two of the best Gen 9 Pokemon. Outside the games, Charcadet only has a quick appearance in Pokemon: Paldean Winds , while Ceruledge had more screen time when it appeared as Amethio's Pokemon, one of the antagonists of Pokemon: Horizons . Charcadet is a small Pokemon that draws attention for its knight-like appearance, and to show the potential that the Pokemon could achieve, a fan designed new forms for it.

Related
Pokemon Fan Shows What Charcadet Line Would Look Like in Paper Mario Style
One creative Pokemon fan artist designs a family of some of the Paldea region's most famous Pokemon in a classic Paper Mario art style.

Twitter user OnduRegion created four new forms for Charcadet, suggesting what it would be like if it could evolve into a new creature in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Aracniddle has huge tweezers coming out of its body, resulting in a creature that would have a big chance of becoming one of the coolest bug Pokemon . One of Drillava's hands is a drill, and details in the design may remind Pokemon fans of Golurk. Hydralgon's fists live up to the Pokemon's name and have two dragon heads, while Brawlord has imposing fists that levitate around it.

Pokemon Fan Art Gives Charcadet Four New Evolutions with Different Concepts

Making their artwork even more appealing, the artist shared additional information about the four Pokemon, such as abilities, Pokedex entries, and the evolution criteria for each form. Charcadet evolves into the Fire/Bug-type Aracniddle when it receives the Parasite Armor item and transforms into the Fire/Ground-type Drillava when it gets the Golem Armor. Charcadet's evolution into the Fire/Dragon-type Hydralgon happens when the Pokemon gains the Scale Armor. Receiving a fang from the adorable baby Pokemon Riolu , Charcadet evolves into the Fire/Fighting-type Brawlord.

That isn't the first time OnduRegion has created an impressive evolution for a Pokemon, having previously given Hawlucha a wrestling-inspired design , earning praise from the community by sharing their work. In Charcadet's fan art, the artist stands out with the intriguing lore and the bolder designs. With Pokemon Legends: Z-A hitting the shelves next year, fans will have to wait to find out which Pokemon will get a new evolution, and whether Charcadet will be one of them.

item.title: Microsoft Rewards Adds Helpful New Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Microsoft Rewards offers points for using Microsoft products daily, with new Streak Protection feature for uninterrupted streaks.
  • Users can earn points for tasks like searching with Bing, playing Xbox games, and make donations or purchases with points.
  • Streak Protection allows users to miss up to 14 days without losing their streak, but must remember to turn it off to avoid using multiple protections.

Microsoft has rolled out an update to its Microsoft Rewards program that looks to help users earn more Microsoft points. While it began hitting Rewards dashboards back in March, more Microsoft Rewards users should see the new support measure showing up for them.

Microsoft Rewards encourages users to use Microsoft products by doling out points for things they do online on a near-daily basis, like searching with Bing or Edge, playing games on Xbox systems or the Xbox app, and purchasing things from the Microsoft store. These points can be used to enter sweepstakes for Microsoft products , purchase Microsoft gift cards, or even make a monetary donation to a nonprofit organization. Rewards users also receive a daily list of personalized actions on their Rewards dashboard that they can complete to earn bonus points. By completing their daily activities, users build up a streak that earns them more points the longer they can keep it going, but missing one day resets the streak and the bonus points entirely.

Related
How PlayStation Stars Compares to Microsoft Rewards
Although Sony's PlayStation Stars loyalty program is similar to Microsoft Rewards, there are several differences that help it stand out.

But, as it happens, sometimes life gets in the way of a good streak. Back in March, the official Microsoft Bing Developer account quietly announced in a tweet that Microsoft would begin adding a Streak Protection feature to the Microsoft Rewards dashboard. Users can activate the feature if they don't think they're going to get to their activities that day for up to 14 missed days per year.

Rolling Out Microsoft Rewards Streak Protection

When this was announced back in March, it was still being rolled out to a fairly small group of users. Since then, users like Video Game Tracker's Alan Feely have reported the feature becoming available to more Rewards accounts. User reception to Streak Protection has been somewhat mixed, with most expressing relief that they'll be able to keep their streak even if they happen to go on vacation and can't get to their activities on a particular day.

Anyone who's ever lost a Duolingo streak understands the emotional devastation that comes with breaking a streak. On paper, it seems like a great way to keep users interested and invested in the Microsoft Rewards program.

Other users have been pointing out what is either a glitch or design oversight: When a user activates Streak Protection for a particular day, they must remember to turn it off the following day, or they'll burn another Streak Protection. Some users have reported that they've turned it on and left it on just in case something comes up. A week and a half later, they'll receive a notification saying that they're almost out of Streak Protection days even if they've been completing their allotted daily activities every day since. So, while Microsoft 's new feature seems to be a major relief for those who can't get to their Microsoft Rewards dashboards every day , there do seem to be some drawbacks that may prevent users from reaching the elusive 999-day Rewards Streak badge.

item.title: Pokemon GO Leak Reveals New GO Fest 2024 Details
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO Fest 2024 will feature in-person events in Sendai, Madrid, and New York City, with players battling Necrozma in raids.
  • The event will have bonuses like Pokemon appearances based on habitats, raids with Espeon and Umbreon, and the introduction of Ultra Beasts.
  • A leak has revealed that players will have the opportunity to choose branches focused on Eevee, shiny Crabrawler, shiny Ducklett, and shiny Emolga.

A new Pokemon GO leak has been revealed, giving information about Pokemon GO Fest 2024 and the debut of three shiny Pokemon. Pokemon GO players unite yearly for the most anticipated event in Niantic's game calendar, the Pokemon GO Fest. With global and in-person activities in different cities, GO Fest is a Pokemon GO celebration that always brings surprises for trainers.

Like the previous edition, Pokemon GO Fest 2024 will be segmented into two parts. The first will see in-person events in Sendai (Japan), Madrid (Spain), and the U.S. (New York City), with Pokemon GO players battling Necrozma in raids . In the second part, available to players worldwide, Pokemon GO will have bonuses such as Pokemon appearances according to habitats, raids with Espeon and Umbreon using accessories, and Ultra Beasts. Pokemon GO Fest is undeniably a special experience for players, and a new leak has revealed more of what to expect from the event this year.

Related
Pokemon GO Player Completes Incredibly Hard Research
A Pokemon GO player shows great dedication, and completes a Research that other trainers consider to be the hardest in the game.

Pokemon GO Hub has reported a new leak giving information about the Pokemon GO Fest 2024 in-person events . According to the leak, the park experience Special Research will be divided into six parts, while the city experience will have five parts. Pokemon GO players already know the habitats that will have Pokemon-specific spawns, such as Brilliant Skies, Cursed Forest, and Ghostly Woods. The leak reveals that their missions will be to catch Pokemon, take snapshots of captured Pokemon, and spin PokeStops and Gyms.

Leak Reveals Quests and New Pokemon for Pokemon GO Fest 2024

The leak reports the existence of four branches that Pokemon GO players will be able to choose from during GO Fest 2024. Each branch is focused on a Pokemon, these being Eevee, shiny Crabrawler, shiny Ducklett, and shiny Emolga. By selecting a branch, Pokemon GO players' radar will prioritize the chosen Pokemon when displaying the list of nearby critters. Pokemon GO players will also find three Pokemon in their regular forms by following Routes and completing one of Pokemon GO 's Party Challenges .

This new round of leaks brings the exciting information about shiny Epolga, Crabrawler, and Ducklett appearing for the first time in Pokemon GO . It joins another Pokemon GO leak with info about Necrozma , revealing that the Pokemon will have access to its fusions with Lunala and Solgaleo. The Pokemon GO Fest 2024 doesn't kick off until the end of May with the events in Sendai, but until then, players can expect new details and reveals to hype up the celebration.

item.title: NBA Star Luka Doncic Reveals Impressive Overwatch 2 Accomplishment
item.description:
Highlights

  • NBA star Luka Doncic achieved Top 500 rank in Overwatch 2, showcasing his dedication to competitive gaming despite his basketball commitments.
  • The upcoming May 14 update for Overwatch 2 includes significant enhancements for tank players and a collaboration with Porsche for a special D.Va skin.

NBA star Luka Doncic has made headlines, not for his skills on the basketball court, but for his remarkable achievement of reaching the top 500 in Overwatch 2 . Created by Blizzard Entertainment, Overwatch 2 is a captivating team-based shooter known for its diverse range of characters and dynamic gameplay. Building upon Overwatch 's success, the sequel introduces new heroes, maps, and game modes while refining core mechanics. With its emphasis on teamwork and skillful play, Overwatch 2 continues to offer thrilling combat encounters and teamplay experiences.

Overwatch 2 comes with a 5v5 format , transitioning from its predecessor's 6v6 team structure, aiming to enhance strategic depth and overall gameplay experience. This made matchmaking much faster and with teams having only one frontline hero, it's up to the tank to press forward and make way for other teammates. With one less player on each team, matches become more focused and dynamic, encouraging tighter coordination and individual player impact. While some may miss the traditional format, many embrace the change to faster-paced matches and increased strategic depth.

Related
Overwatch 2 Hanaoka Map Has a Hidden Room
Some Overwatch 2 fans have discovered an easter egg on the new Hanaoka map in the form of a secret room near one of the spawn locations.

Luka Doncic Makes it to Top 500 in Overwatch 2

NBA superstar Luka Doncic has reached the coveted Top 500 rank in Overwatch 2. Notably, Doncic attained this feat while playing on a laptop, which makes the gameplay a tad harder unless it's a high-end gaming laptop. This achievement marks yet another instance of Doncic's passion for gaming, following his previous encounters in Grand Master lobbies and Twitch streams.

Despite his commitments with the Dallas Mavericks and their ongoing pursuit of a championship title, Doncic has demonstrated remarkable skill and dedication, positioning himself as one of the best players in competitive gaming. Posting his accomplishment on Instagram (as shared by Dexerto ), Doncic showcased his Top 500 Tank rank in Overwatch 2 's 10th season , obtained amid the busy playoffs.

Speaking of season 10, players are expecting the mid-season update very soon. May 14 promises excitement for Overwatch 2 fans as a collaboration with Porsche brings a special skin for D.Va, adding a new dimension to the gaming experience. This partnership reflects the game's popularity and its ability to attract collaborations beyond the gaming industry. Fans eagerly anticipate the release, with D.Va enthusiasts particularly thrilled about the new cosmetic addition.

The upcoming May 14 update for Overwatch 2 promises significant enhancements for tank players . Notable adjustments include a 25% reduction in damage from headshots, increased knockback resistance to 50%, and improvements to armor and HP recovery mechanics. Additionally, specific hero buffs are in store, with Wrecking Ball and Junker Queen receiving targeted enhancements to their abilities. As Overwatch 2 continues to evolve with updates and collaborations, Doncic's accomplishment adds to the game's appeal, attracting attention from both sports and gaming enthusiasts alike. With his dual success in basketball and gaming, Doncic exemplifies the versatility of modern athletes and the ever-expanding reach of esports into mainstream culture.

item.title: Gamer Discovers Nostalgic Gaming Achievement After 40 Years
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gaming achievements have evolved from tangible rewards in the 1980s to digital trophies on modern consoles like Xbox and PS.
  • The rediscovery of an Activision patch from 1983 has sparked nostalgia among gamers, showcasing the history of gaming milestones.
  • While physical awards like the Activision patches are rare now, some modern gaming competitions still offer unique prizes to winners.

A gamer was hit with a serious case of nostalgia after rediscovering their oldest gaming achievement award, dating back to 1983. The gaming achievement is bringing back fond memories for some gamers, while younger gamers are marveling about the way Activision celebrated gaming achievements long ago.

While in-game achievements have existed in some titles before consoles got involved, gamers really started to take note of achievements in the early 2000s. Starting with the Xbox 360 and PS3, achievement or trophy lists became an effective and exciting way to show one's progress in a game and brag about pulling off difficult tasks. To this day, some gamers feel they're not done with a game until they've completely polished off the achievement list, even if it means earning some of the most difficult gaming achievements to do so. However, some games had a tangible reward for certain achievements back in the 1980s, as one fan demonstrated.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Spends Over 1,000 Hours Unlocking the Game's Hardest Achievement
One Fallout 4 achievement has made players scratch their heads since the game's release, and this player spent a ridiculously long time chasing it.

Reddit user whyforyoulookmeonso shared a photo of a letter and an achievement patch they received from Activision back in the day for their accomplishments in the game Pitfall . Back in the day, the player photographed their TV screen, showing that they had earned at least 20,000 points in the game, and sent it in to Activision. The company, which had only existed for 4 years at that point, responded with the letter congratulating the player on their achievement and encouraging them to keep working hard in its titles. The patch, which could be ironed or sewn on to clothing, noted the player as a member of the Activision Explorers' Club, giving them a literal badge of honor to show off.

As it turns out, some other gamers on the site also fondly remember these 1980s nostalgic gaming patches, and either earned or tried to earn their own. While Pitfall was a popular game, it wasn't the only Activision title to get this treatment. In fact, there was a whole slew of releases from the game publisher that fans could earn achievements from, including Tennis , Space Shuttle , and Chopper Command . Pitfall 2 also had its own patch and achievement, tasking the player with earning 99,000 points to get a Cliff Hangers patch.

Gaming Awards Have (Mostly) Gone Digital

These days, gaming achievements are usually limited to a screen. Other than a record of points earned, there isn't much to physically show for clearing a game 100%. However, in some rare cases, physical awards have made a comeback. A chance to be added to the Xbox Hall of Fame , for example, came with an actual Xbox Series X for the winner. While the Activision patches are nostalgic, it's unfortunately unlikely that any major game publisher will do something like that as a regular thing ever again.
